page.title: 09Churches in Pitreavie
page.content: Religion in Pitreavie In out area we have St. Leonard's Church in St. Leonard's Street. It is one of only two churches in Britain with a round steeple. It looks very old but it is only 82 years old. It was built for the houses in the Brucefield area. St. Ninian's Church was built for the new houses in the Abbeyview Estate. It is Church of Scotland as well. Our Lady of Lourdes Church is Roman Catholic. It is a new church between Pitcorthie (Pitreavie) and Abbeyview estates. Near St. Andrew's Street shopping area is the small Gospel Hall. In the north of Rosyth is a Methodist church. On the west side of the road, almost opposite, is a Baptist church. Services are held on Sundays but some groups meet during the week.V Paterson
